intro: Monechma praecox, commonly known as the early monechma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces smooth, elongated fruits. Monechma praecox is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
